title: Artificial Intelligence Fundamentals and Ethics: Everyday Applications and Ethical Reasoning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic digital literacy (ability to use computers/smartphones) and general understanding of social issues

learning_goals: Students can explain the fundamental principles and operational mechanisms of AI technologies encountered in daily life, such as chatbots and recommendation systems.
Students can analyze ethical issues related to AI (privacy, bias, accountability, etc.) by connecting them to specific case studies.
Students can engage in discussions based on critical thinking about the positive/negative impacts of AI across diverse social contexts.
